channel.title: Blue Book News
channel.description: Blue Book Online Services News provides up-to-date information on the top stories affecting you in the produce industry in the topic areas of bankruptcies, mergers, acquisitions, quarterly company results, PACA actions and more.

item.title: Testing Bold in Posts
item.description: ROCHESTER, N.Y., April 29, 2019/PRNewswire/ -- Wegmans BB #:104173 today announced that it's teaming up with the largest and fastest growing, last-mile logistics platform, DoorDash, for delivery of the supermarket's popular restaurant-quality meals available in the new Wegmans Meals 2GO app. The venture is now live at the Dulles (Sterling) store in northern Virginia, and the Pittsford, East Ave., and Perinton stores in Rochester, NY. Two more Rochester-area stores, Penfield. and Holt Road, are set to go live on April 30. Wegmans Meals 2GO will roll out to more than 40 stores by year's end, with more to follow in 2020.

item.title: Rio Grande Valley sees inventive independent retailers
item.description: While H-E-B and Walmart rule the roost throughout the Valley’s high-population areas, a handful of grocers have managed to find their niche in more remote, rural areas.

item.title: What is Walmart doing with small format stores?
item.description: A few stories have come across my news feed over the past few days suggesting Walmart (BB #:143789) is “quietly” closing stores in the next month or so.

item.title: California HLB fight bolstered by Swiss fragrance company
item.description: California stands alone among growing regions battling – and so far, containing – huanglongbing, and the latest investment shows that allies come from all over.

item.title: E-commerce: the enemy of produce brands?
item.description: I gave a talk last week in Tubac, AZ, to the Association of Table Grape Growers of Mexico at their annual Spring Summit. This was a repeat performance for me – I’ve previously addressed this group about grape merchandising trends in U.S. retailers.

item.title: NGA pushes for more hunger relief at retail
item.description: The National Grocers Association continues to work with USDA to allow NGA’s retail members better access to government food programs.

item.title: Management guru Morten Hansen to Keynote United Fresh
item.description: WASHINGTON, D.C. (March 25, 2019) – Morten Hansen, one of the leading management authorities of our time, will set the stage for this year’s United Fresh Convention & Expo as keynote speaker during the United Fresh Breakfast General Session, Tuesday, June 11 at McCormick Place in Chicago.

item.title: PMA Foodservice moves expo to Saturday, announces Keynote speakers
item.description: Newark, Del. - Two heavyweights in the food culture industry will share the marquee at Produce Marketing Association’s Foodservice Conference & Expo in Monterey, CA, in July.

item.title: PBH launches food influencer network
item.description: PRESS RELEASE March 25, 2019 – The Produce for Better Health Foundation (PBH) will launch its new elite influencer network – Fruit and Vegetable Ambassadors in Action (FVAA) – at the upcoming Consumer Connection Conference this April 22-25, 2019 in Scottsdale, AZ.

item.title: Nogales produce cargo could get a faster trip across the border
item.description: TUBAC, AZ—The nearly $3 billion in produce crossings at the Mariposa Port of Entry in Nogales could get a faster ride through the border checkpoint if plans for a new cargo lane move forward as quickly as Customs and Border Protection hope.

item.title: Avocados recalled on positive Listeria sample
item.description: Henry Avocado Corporation is voluntarily recalling California-grown whole avocados sold in bulk at retail stores because they have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes. Henry Avocado is issuing this voluntary recall out of an abundance of caution due to positive test results on environmental samples taken during a routine government inspection at its California packing facility. There are no reported illnesses associated with this recall.

item.title: Kroger to sell Turkey Hill business
item.description: PRESS RELEASE The Kroger Co. and Peak Rock Capital, a leading middle-market private equity firm based in Austin, Texas, has announced a definitive agreement for the sale of Kroger's Turkey Hill business to an affiliate of Peak Rock Capital.

item.title: Mexican grape estimate shows sharp increase over 2018
item.description: TUBAC, AZ —The estimate is in earlier than usual this year, but if it holds, Mexican grape growers will export about 34% more boxes than in the 2018 season.

item.title: When media swallows the Dirty Dozen
item.description: It turns out mom was wrong, and I’m not supposed to eat my veggies because they’re toxic!

item.title: 'Only Organic' sums up the GRO Organic program
item.description: As the organic sales growth rate slows, stakeholders embark on a new voluntary check-off program of promotion, education and grower assistance.

item.title: Organic Produce Summit announces food waste session
item.description: PRESS RELEASE With global food loss and waste estimated to be between one-third and one-half of all food produced, its impact on the environment and a company’s bottom line will be the subject of the third of six educational sessions at Organic Produce Summit 2019.

item.title: The New England Organic Produce Conference committee announces retailer roundtable participants
item.description: The New England Produce Council (NEPC) and the Organic Produce Network (OPN) announced the retailer participants for the roundtable session. Brian Fleming (Stop & Shop Supermarket), Kevin Barry (Big Y Foods) and Mark Jewell (Hannaford Bros. Supermarket) will speak at the retailer roundtable on May 1<sup>st</sup> at the New England Organic Produce Conference being held at Gillette Stadium.

item.title: USDA cites Penny Tsigaris, d/b/a Manavi Produce, in New York for PACA violations
item.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has cited Penny Tsigaris, doing business as Manavi Produce (Tsigaris dba Manavi), Oceanside, NY, for failing to pay for produce.

item.title: Crecimiento de las exportaciones de aguacate: Perú
item.description: Se estima que se consumieron 8 millones de libras de guacamole en el die del Super Bowl el domingo de este año, y la mayoría de ellas provino de México, ya que tiene un bastión en el mercado del aguacate en los Estados Unidos. Sin embargo, otro país latino está estableciendo nuevos récords en la exportación de aguacate.

item.description: En español

item.title: Studies contradict “Dirty Dozen” unsafe implication
item.description: PRESS RELEASE Since 1995, an activist group has released a so-called “dirty dozen” produce list.

item.title: Dirty Dozen, Clean Fifteen lists released
item.description: Saying nearly 70 percent of fresh fruits and vegetables sold in the U.S. contain pesticide residue, the Environmental Working Group released its annual Shopper’s Guide to Pesticides in Produce, which includes its Dirty Dozen.

item.title: Walmart drops the ball with Savings Catcher cancellation
USDA to raise inspection fees this fall
item.description: USDA’s Specialty Crop Program inspections will rise Oct. 1, as it modernizes into a more data-driven, customer-focused organization.

item.title: Performance Food Group Company to acquire Eby-Brown Company LLC
item.description: Performance Food Group Company has announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire Eby-Brown Company LLC, a leading U.S. distributor of pre-packaged candy, snacks, specialty beverages and tobacco products in the convenience industry.

item.title: Fresh Farms merges with Visalia Produce
item.description: PRESS RELEASE The Molina Family of Hermosillo, Sonora, Mexico, is very excited to announce the merger of their two U.S. sales and distribution companies.

item.title: USDA lifts PACA reparation sanctions on New York produce business
item.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) announced that Utopia Produce, Inc. satisfied a reparation order issued under the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act (PACA).

item.title: USDA lifts PACA reparation sanctions on New York produce business
item.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) announced that Utopia Produce, Inc. satisfied a reparation order issued under the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act (PACA).

item.title: Expect higher prices for a smaller Vidalia onion crop
item.description: Buyers should see a smaller crop of Vidalia onions this season, as the official first pack date has been set, and the overall onion market sees a spring price surge.

item.title: SXSW: The future of eating isn’t what you think
item.description: AUSTIN, TX—With conference topics like dystopian future bug diets, customized nutrition and electronic baristas, a panel put together to discuss the future of eating at South by Southwest had a message many in the room didn’t expect.

item.title: United Fresh releases 25 Retail Produce Manager Award Honorees
item.description: PRESS RELEASE Marking 15 years of recognizing exceptional retail produce managers, on March 18 United Fresh Produce Association announced the honorees of its 2019 Retail Produce Manager Awards Program. The group of 25 produce managers represents supermarket banners, commissaries and independent retail stores from 16 different states and two Canadian provinces. The winners will be honored guests at the United Fresh 2019 convention, June 10-12 in Chicago.

item.title: Industry seeks changes to Hours of Service, Electronic Logging Device rules
item.description: PRESS RELEASE A petition for rulemaking was filed March 15 by United Fresh and other agricultural associations to receive modification to the Hours of Service (HOS) and Electronic Logging Device (ELD) rules for perishable fruit and vegetable commodities.

item.title: Grow. Don’t take the status quo
item.description: There is no status quo associated with this dynamic industry. It is constantly changing.

item.title: Produce for Better Health Foundation releases line-up for Consumer Connection conference
item.description: PRESS RELEASE March 15, 2019 – Produce for Better Health Foundation (PBH), a nonprofit organization whose mission is to improve Americans’ health and happiness by eating more fruits and vegetables every day, has confirmed an outstanding line-up for its 2019 Consumer Connection program.

item.title: Plenty of California navels at midseason
item.description: California citrus growers are about halfway through harvesting a large crop with a wide size range.

item.title: Weis Markets reports results for 2018 and fourth quarter
item.description: Weis Markets, Inc., has reported record total sales of over $3.5 billion for the 52-week period ended December 29, 2018, up 1.2 percent compared to the same period a year ago, while annual comparable store sales increased 0.7 percent.

item.title: The Produce Reporter Week in Review: March 15, 2019
item.description: Greg and Pamela talk about what the fresh produce industry can take away from visits to Southern Exposure and South by Southwest.

item.title: Dollar General paving way for fresh produce self-distribution
item.description: Goodlettsville, TN-based Dollar General’s expansion into fresh food is prompting the company to accelerate its self-distribution with a new DG Fresh initiative.

item.title: Cheeselandia at SXSW...what fresh produce marketers can learn from 150 samples of cheese
item.description: AUSTIN, TX -- The annual South by Southwest conference is well known for over-the-top promotions designed to generate buzz among attendees.

item.title: MAP: Where in Houston can you get Kroger's driverless delivery?
item.description: HOUSTON, March 14, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- The Kroger Co. (NYSE: KR), America's largest grocery retailer and Nuro, the robotics company transforming local commerce, today announced the launch of their autonomous grocery delivery service in Houston. The innovative service will be available through two Houston Kroger stores, reaching customers residing in four local zip codes.

item.title: Covenant Transportation Group announced fourth quarter 2018 financial and operating results
item.description: Covenant Transportation Group, Inc., announced financial and operating results for the fourth quarter ended December 31, 2018.

item.title: Limoneira Company announces first quarter fiscal year 2019 financial results
item.description: Limoneira Company, a diversified citrus packing, selling, and marketing company with related agribusiness activities and real estate development operations, has reported financial results for the first quarter ended January 31, 2019.

item.title: Roadrunner Transportation Systems reports fourth quarter and full year 2018 operating results
item.description: Roadrunner Transportation Systems, Inc., a leading asset-right transportation and asset-light logistics service provider, has announced results for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2018 and the filing of its Annual Report on Form 10-K.

item.title: United Fresh to present five Council Awards
item.description: PRESS RELEASE WASHINGTON, D.C. (March 14, 2019) – New this year, United Fresh will honor five individuals for their outstanding work in sharing their expertise in different areas serving our produce industry. The honorees will be recognized at the United Fresh Convention & Expo June 10-12 in Chicago.

item.title: Apple growers visit Washington to talk trade, ag labor
item.description: PRESS RELEASE Washington, D.C. (March 13, 2019)—More than 90 apple growers from across the nation met March 13 in Washington, D.C., to take part in the U.S. Apple Association’s (USApple) annual Capitol Hill Day. Meeting with more than 100 legislative offices during the fly-in, they expressed their support and concerns for priority issues like ratification of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada (USMCA) trade agreement, agriculture labor and implementation of the farm bill.

item.title: Fresh produce needs even more SXSW representation
item.description: AUSTIN, TX—As someone who has lived in the Austin area full time for nearly two decades, I’ve treated the annual South by Southwest conference with a local’s disdain and avoidance.

item.title: Produce with Pamela at SXSW
item.description: AUSTIN, TX -- What is South by Southwest, and why is produce at the event? Cathy Burns from the Produce Marketing Association stopped by to chat at the PMA Global Street Farm.

item.title: Jim Lemke, president of Robinson Fresh, retires from C.H. Robinson
item.description: PRESS RELEASE After nearly three decades of leadership, Jim Lemke, president of Robinson Fresh, a division of C.H. Robinson, announces plans to retire in 2019. Lemke will focus his remaining time at Robinson Fresh on ensuring a smooth leadership transition.

item.title: Pushing deeper in the snack market
item.description: ORLANDO, FL – Produce marketers have been advised to offer their products in more places for more consumer eating opportunities, and it was clear on the expo floor of Southern Exposure, March 9, they’re putting that advice into practice.

item.title: Mastronardi Produce and John Paul DeJoria announce partnership to revolutionize fresh food availability
item.description: Mastronardi Produce®, the leading greenhouse company in North America, announced today that it has teamed up with John Paul DeJoria to make quality, flavorful produce more widely accessible. The partnership will focus on developing Advanced High-Density Farming Systems to grow local fresh food in underserved markets around the globe.

item.title: USDA cites Paradise Produce LLC in Nevada for PACA violations
item.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has cited Paradise Produce LLC, Las Vegas, Nev., for failure to pay for produce.

item.title: SXSW: Health alone won’t increase consumption
item.description: AUSTIN, TX—It’s no secret that fresh produce checks all the boxes for health and wellness, but the problem is people’s food decisions – for the most part – aren’t rational.

item.title: Iceberg lettuce – not so ordinary
item.description: Iceberg or head lettuce is not typically thought of as exceptional.

item.title: Organic Cuties debut at SEPC
item.description: ORLANDO, FL – Sun Pacific Marketing Cooperative, Pasadena, CA, showed its organic Cuties for the first time at the Southeast Produce Council’s Southern Exposure expo March 9.

item.title: Wholesum to expand Fair Trade reach with organic artichokes program
item.description: Wholesum™ announced today that they will be growing their Fair Trade certified program by introducing organically grown artichokes from Salinas, California with harvests starting at the end of April. The organic artichokes will be grown by a California based partner farm, who is committed to growing organically with Fair Trade certification.

item.title: American employers harmed by decision to limit Mexican tomatoes
item.description: Up to 33,000 American jobs are threatened by a Department of Commerce decision that would have the double impact of increasing tomato prices for American consumers.

item.title: Apeel gets retail validation from Midwest chain
item.description: ORLANDO, FL – A Midwest retail chain tested Apeel’s plant-based coatings on its avocados and liked it enough to commit fully to the technology.

item.title: Guatemalan Produce Trade Association continues growth
item.description: The Guatemalan Produce Trade Association (GPTA), comprised of the major importers and key players in the Guatemalan produce trade, is amplifying its influence and involvement in strategic issues and industry events. Members of the association share their perspective and outlook for Guatemala’s continuing trade.

item.title: The food desert solution: fast, cheap…and fresh
item.description: AUSTIN, TX—Food deserts don’t happen because people don’t want to eat healthy food.

item.title: SEPC: Translating science into action
item.description: ORLANDO, FL – Some of the smartest people in the produce industry work in food safety, but if that work isn’t turned into something useable and explained to the rest of the industry, it won’t be as effective.

item.title: Fullei Fresh recalls organic bean sprouts
item.description: Fullei Fresh of Miami, Florida is voluntarily recalling Organic Bean Sprouts because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism which can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women.

item.title: SEPC: Retailers adjust to shifting consumer demand
item.description: ORLANDO, FL – Now that “produce department” has overtaken “price” as the No.1 reason consumers choose a grocery store, retailers must find their best way to deliver a good experience.

item.title: Wegmans tops another list
item.description: How can a company that operates in only six states rank so high in yet another nationwide list? In this case, Rochester, NY-based Wegmans Food Markets' reputation precedes it.

item.title: United Natural Foods, Inc. reports second quarter fiscal 2019 results
item.description: United Natural Foods, Inc., has reported financial results for the second quarter of fiscal 2019 ended January 26, 2019.

item.title: Calavo Growers, Inc. announces fiscal 2019 first quarter results
item.description: Calavo Growers, Inc., has reported that fiscal 2019 first quarter adjusted net income rose 36 percent on a 17 percent increase in gross profit over the corresponding period last year. Operating income advanced 53 percent in the most-recent quarter, according to the company, a global avocado-industry leader and expanding provider of value-added fresh food.

item.title: Let's go to The Mango Store
item.description: I’m kind of sad I didn’t get a chance to visit the “The Mango Store,” a “one-day opportunity to discover the culture, flavor, nutrition and versatility of mangos,” in New York on March 7.

item.title: SEPC: Exploring food as medicine
item.description: ORLANDO, FL – For years fresh produce marketers have operated on the principle that consumers know fruits and vegetables are good for them, but they don’t eat as much as they should because of taste, convenience or price.

item.title: Apeel Science Helping Martin's to Virtually Eliminate Shrink in Avocado Category
item.description: PRESS RELEASE Just a few weeks in, Apeel Avocados are soon to represent 100% of the fresh avocados offered at Martin’s Super Markets.

item.title: Kroger plans to expand self-driving grocery delivery pilot
item.description: Kroger Co. CEO Rodney McMullen said the company has expanded Home Chef meal kits to an additional 500 markets, and other pilot programs are slated for expansion.

item.title: Costco posts Q2 sales growth but not in fresh
item.description: Costco Wholesale Corp. showed a 7.3 percent sales increase in the second quarter but noted fresh food sales dropped a little.

item.description: WASHINGTON, D.C. (March 7, 2019) – United Fresh is pleased to announce that the Harmonized Standard Audit is now available from the following auditing organizations:

item.title: No, avocados are not pricier because of fad diets
item.description: A recent Wall Street Journal article sent me down a rabbit hole of data. The article, published Feb 25, claimed “Your Avocados and Olives are Pricier Because Fat is in Fashion.”

item.title: PMA taps out-of-this-world speaker for Fresh Connections: Mexico
item.description: Former astronaut José Hernández is the featured speaker at Produce Marketing Association’s (PMA) Fresh Connections: Mexico scheduled May 29-30 at the Hotel Hard Rock in Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico.

item.title: Oppy chosen as Canada’s Best Managed for 18th year
item.description: What makes a “best managed” company? According to the global financial services company Deloitte, companies with best-in-class business practices—like the Vancouver, BC-based Oppy—demonstrate exceptional strategy, capability, commitment, and return on investment.

item.title: UNFI: Supervalu “disappointing,” Albert’s to integrate conventional produce
item.description: United Natural Foods Inc. executives said even though they’ve been disappointed with the performance of Supervalu’s business since the acquisition this summer, they’d make the same decision again.

item.title: Carton advancements double avocado shelf life for WP Produce
item.description: Avocado demand is up across the board, but tropical — or green skin — avocados have shelf life challenges that can be a barrier for expansion in some markets.

item.title: Pure Flavor’s new Georgia greenhouse growing results
item.description: Now almost 3 months since their first picks of fresh greenhouse grown vegetables from their new Fort Valley, GA greenhouse facility, Pure Flavor® has started to change the landscape in the southeast.

item.title: Stakeholders invest $1.5 million to advance organic
item.description: Washington, D.C., March 05, 2019 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Much can happen in a year, as a major collective effort underway by the organic community is proving. Scores of organic companies and stakeholders have enthusiastically stepped up to invest almost $1.5 million in programs to advance organic food and farming -- initiatives to promote organic, educate consumers about organic’s benefits, assist organic farmers and foster critical organic research. And this is just the beginning.

item.title: FDA commissioner Gottlieb to step down
item.description: U.S. Food and Drug Administration commissioner Scott Gottlieb resigned today.

item.title: SpartanNash launches Kids Crew program for retail
item.description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. – To encourage healthy eating choices for children and reinforce its commitment to health and wellness in every aisle of its retail stores, SpartanNash today introduced its new Kids Crew program.

item.title: Trader Joe’s reduces plastic in produce packaging
item.description: Traditionally close-mouthed Trader Joe’s subtly announced in its latest Fearless Flyer newsletter it plans to start reducing plastic throughout its store, including fresh produce packaging.

item.title: Puerto de Virginia está listo para más productos frescos sudamericanos
item.description: El Departamento de Agricultura de los Estados Unidos ha otorgado al Puerto de Virginia la aprobación para importar fruta sudamericana esta semana.

item.title: Port of Virginia is ready for more South American produce
item.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture has given the Port of Virginia approval to import South American fruit this week.

item.title: Matson, Inc. announces fourth quarter and full year 2018 results
item.description: Matson, Inc., a leading U.S. carrier in the Pacific, has reported net income of $20.6 million, or $0.48 per diluted share, for the quarter ended December 31, 2018. Net income for the quarter ended December 31, 2017 was $166.9 million, or $3.90 per diluted share. Net income and earnings per share in the fourth quarter of 2017 benefitted by $155.0 million and $3.62 per diluted share, respectively, from a one-time, non-cash tax adjustment arising from the enactment of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (the "Tax Act"). Consolidated revenue for the fourth quarter 2018 was $564.9 million compared with $516.1 million for the fourth quarter 2017.

item.title: The Chefs’ Warehouse reports fourth quarter 2018 financial results
item.description: The Chefs’ Warehouse, Inc., a premier distributor of specialty food products in the United States and Canada, has reported financial results for its fourth quarter ended December 28, 2018.

item.title: Hub Group, Inc. reports record fourth quarter 2018 results
item.description: Hub Group, Inc., has announced fourth quarter 2018 net income of $48.9 million, or diluted earnings per share of $1.46. Income from continuing operations for the current quarter was $33.7 million, or $1.01 per diluted share. Income from discontinued operations for the current quarter was $15.2 million, or $0.45 per diluted share.

item.title: Werner Enterprises reports fourth quarter and full year 2018 results
item.description: Werner Enterprises, Inc., one of the nation’s largest transportation and logistics companies, has reported financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2018.

item.title: Gelson's relaunches Chef'd meal kits
item.description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., March 4, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- True Food Innovations, based in Newport Beach, California, is launching new products under both True Chef™ and Chef'd™ branded retail meal kits with fresh, clean label, preservative-free recipes in Gelson's Markets. All recipes only require 15 minutes of total prep and cook time.

item.title: SEPC and 20 years of Southern Exposure
item.description: The Southeast Produce Council has seen its Southern Exposure annual conference emerge as a must-see event as it celebrates its 20th anniversary this week.

item.title: Publix announces fourth quarter and annual results for 2018
item.description: Publix’s sales for the three months ended Dec. 29, 2018 were $9.3 billion, a 3.8 percent increase from $8.9 billion in 2017. Comparable store sales for the three months ended Dec. 29, 2018 increased 1.1 percent.Net earnings for the three months ended Dec. 29, 2018 were $407 million, compared to $766.6 million in 2017, a decrease of 46.9 percent. Earnings per share for the three months ended Dec. 29, 2018 decreased to $0.57 per share, down from $1.04 per share in 2017.

item.title: USMCA delay has ag groups concerned
item.description: Agriculture interests, including several in fresh produce, are pushing for adoption of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement, but the government shut down has caused its progress to slow.

item.title: USA Truck reports fourth quarter 2018 results
item.description: USA Truck, Inc., a leading capacity solutions provider, has announced its financial results for the three and twelve months ended December 31, 2018.

item.title: B&G Foods reports financial results for fourth quarter and full year 2018
item.description: B&G Foods, Inc., has announced financial results for the fourth quarter and full year 2018.

item.title: Blue Apron Holdings, Inc. reports fourth quarter and full-year 2018 results
item.description: Blue Apron Holdings, Inc. has announced financial results for the quarter and full year ended December 31, 2018. Blue Apron also announced today the transfer of production volume from its Arlington facility to its Linden facility with additional information available in the company’s Current Report on Form 8-K. Blue Apron will hold its scheduled earnings call and webcast tomorrow, January 31, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time to discuss its fourth quarter and full year 2018 results and business outlook.

item.title: Retail stocks gasp at Amazon grocery news
item.description: At approximately 12:38 Eastern Standard Time, the world of grocery stocks took a deep breath…and dropped. Just minutes before, the Wall Street Journal broke a story saying Amazon’s launching a new grocery banner.

item.title: C. H. Robinson reports 2018 fourth quarter and full-year results
item.description: C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc., has reported financial results for the quarter and fiscal year ended December 31, 2018.

item.title: Landstar System reports record fourth quarter revenue
item.description: Landstar System, Inc., has reported record fourth quarter revenue of $1.182 billion in the 2018 fourth quarter, a 12 percent increase over revenue of $1.052 billion reported in the 2017 fourth quarter. Gross profit (defined as revenue less the cost of purchased transportation and commissions to agents) in the 2018 fourth quarter was $168.9 million, 13 percent above the 2017 fourth quarter, while 2018 fourth quarter operating income was $86.1 million, 23 percent above the 2017 fourth quarter. Operating income and gross profit in the 2018 fourth quarter were also each fourth quarter records.

item.title: USDA files action against CKF Produce Corp. in New York for alleged PACA violations
item.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has filed a Notice to Show Cause and complaint under the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act (PACA) against CKF Produce Corp. (CKF). The company, operating from New York, allegedly failed to make payment to 22 produce sellers in the amount of $916,442 from March 2017 through November 2018. USDA asserts that CKF is unfit to be licensed under PACA due to the alleged violations.

item.title: Report: Amazon to launch new grocery brand
item.description: Amazon plans to open grocery stores in several large U.S. cities, distinct from its Whole Foods brand.

item.title: The Produce Reporter Week in Review: March 1, 2019
item.description: Greg and Pamela talk about some of the top stories this week, including:

item.title: United Fresh announces nominations for new board officers and directors
item.description: WASHINGTON, D.C. (March 1, 2019) – United Fresh Immediate Past Chair Susan Reimer-Sifford Fresh Connect, LLC, has announced the slate of new officers and directors nominated to serve on the United Fresh Produce Association Board of Directors, effective at its March 25, 2019 meeting in Nashville, TN.

item.title: FDA releases imported food safety guide
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration released a statement from FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb, M.D., and Deputy Commissioner Frank Yiannas February 25 on a new strategy to advance FDA’s food safety mission and modernize oversight of imported food.

item.title: Study finds equal quality fresh foods at dollar stores
item.description: As deep discount stores, so-called “dollar stores,” add more fresh food to their lineup, a new study by the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, found produce quality was virtually the same as traditional grocers in the area.

item.title: PMA names new CGT Executive Director
item.description: The Produce Marketing Association and Center for Growing Talent have named Doug Bohr as the charitable organization’s next Executive Director. Bohr will join Center for Growing Talent (CGT) March 20, 2019 as longtime leader, Margi Prueitt, retires after 9 years at the helm. Bohr will oversee leadership for CGT, help advance their fundraising efforts, and the continued work to provide solutions to attract, develop and retain the talent the produce and floral communities need to grow.

item.title: NGA to independent grocers: You be you
item.description: SAN DIEGO -- The overall feeling at the National Grocers Association annual convention was one of optimism for independent grocers in the face of increasing competition.

item.title: Viva Fresh Expo Announces 2019 Education Program
item.description: Mission, Texas: February 27, 2019: The 2019 Viva Fresh Produce Expo is excited to announce the agenda for this year’s educational sessions.   The lineup will include a wide-range of topics from steps on how to prevent a food-safety crisis to practical applications of the “food as medicine” movement along with retail trends according to Google.

item.title: Mexico Spring Grape Summit moves to Tubac, AZ
item.description: PRESS RELEASE The Table Grape Growers Association in Mexico invites the industry to participate in the Mexico Spring Summit 2019, to be held in for the first time in Tubac, AZ, on Thursday, March 21st, 2019, at the Tubac Golf Resort & Spa, from 1:00 pm to 10:00 pm. Blue Book's Retail Editor Pamela Riemenschneider will be among the presenters, speaking about e-commerce. For registrations please visit: www.summit.aalpum.org

item.title: Amanda Keefer of Produce for Kids talks the Mission for Nutrition
item.description: Orlando, Fla. – Feb. 25 – Produce for Kids® is aligning with health-conscious brands, commodities and retail dietitians to kick off its inaugural Mission for Nutrition promotion in celebration of National Nutrition Month®. The online and in-store program focuses on the importance of a healthy family diet and the value of meal planning and prepping while aiming to increase the consumption of fresh produce.

item.title: Merchantability – The Other Warranty

item.title: Listeria find prompts value-added green bean, squash recall
item.description: Southern Specialties Inc. of Pompano Beach, Florida is voluntarily recalling select bags of Marketside brand green beans and butternut squash because they have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism which can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women.

item.title: Brambles sale of IFCO RPC pooling business for $2.51 billion

The transaction is subject to customary regulatory approvals and is expected to be completed during the second quarter of calendar year 2019.

item.title: C.H. Robinson names Bob Biesterfeld CEO
item.description: Minneapolis, Minnesota, February 11, 2019 — C.H. Robinson (NASDAQ: CHRW) announced today that Robert (“Bob”) Biesterfeld, currently the Company's Chief Operating Officer, has been named Chief Executive Officer. As part of a long-planned succession process managed by C.H. Robinson’s Board of Directors, Biesterfeld was named COO in March 2018. Biesterfeld has also been nominated to stand for election to the C.H. Robinson Board of Directors. Current Chairman and CEO John Wiehoff will remain Chairman of the Board following this succession. Scott Anderson, current C.H. Robinson Board member, will become the Lead Independent Director. All moves will become effective on May 9, 2019, coinciding with our annual meeting of shareholders.

Additionally, homechef.com has launched a customizable meal kit feature for online orders, allowing customers to have more flexibility in deciding what's for dinner by providing the choice to change and upgrade recipe ingredients. item.title: UNFI sues Goldman Sachs for misconduct in Supervalu acquisition

As executive vice president and chief financial officer for Hormel Foods, Sheehan oversees the company's financial enterprise including accounting, information technology, internal audit, investor relations, corporate tax and treasury.

item.title: Chilean peaches, nectarines, plums recalled due to listeria find
item.description: Press Release -- Jac. Vandenberg, Inc. of Yonkers, New York is recalling 1,727 cartons of Fresh Peaches, 1,207 cartons of Fresh Nectarines and 365 cartons of Fresh Plums because they have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism which can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women.

item.title: Spinach, mesclun recalled in New York, Florida after positive salmonella test
item.description: Company News -- Satur Farms, 3705 Alvah's Lane, Cutchogue, NY 11935 is voluntarily recalling Baby Spinach and Mesclun with the specific lot numbers listed below because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism which can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy persons infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhea (which may be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare circumstances, infection with Salmonella can result in the organism getting into the bloodstream and producing more severe illnesses such as arterial infections (i.e. aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The following product was distributed in New York and Florida through retail stores.

item.title: CPS announces "Innovation Challenge" grant - GRABIT
item.description: The Center for Produce Safety has announced $500,000 is available to fund the center's first Innovation Challenge. Dave Corsi, chair of the CPS Board of Directors stated, "This is an invitation and opportunity for technology innovators to develop, refine and focus their solutions to meet a critical industry need; identifying evidence or conditions where cross contamination can take place in our growing environments. This program, currently termed GRABIT - (Grower's Risk Assessment Biomarkers Investigative Tool) is designed to bring tools to the supply chain to manage risk and meet the CPS mission: Fund the science, find solutions and fuel the change."

item.title: SpartanNash completes acquisition of Indiana-based Martin's Super Markets
item.description: COMPANY PRESS RELEASE -- SpartanNash announced that it has completed the previously announced acquisition of Martin's Super Markets, Inc., a leading family-owned and operated Midwest independent supermarket chain. The transaction closed on December 31, 2018, which is the first day of SpartanNash's first fiscal quarter of 2019. Under the terms of the agreement, SpartanNash acquired 21 Martin's Super Markets, eight Fuel Centers, 17 in-store pharmacies, a pharmacy at Saint Joseph Health System in Mishawaka (IN), a Martin's Express convenience store in South Bend (IN) and a Side Door Café at Elkhart General Hospital. SpartanNash will provide additional guidance to the investor community in its fourth quarter 2018 earnings announcement to be released February 19, 2019.

Zimmermann will continue to report to Keith Knopf, Raley’s President & Chief Executive Officer.

item.title: Brighter Bites in action
item.description: AUSTIN, TX—I stopped by a local elementary school to pack bags for the most recent Brighter Bites distribution to see for myself how the program works.

item.title: Calavo Growers, Inc. announces 2018 fourth quarter and full-year results
item.description: FINANCIAL RELEASE – Calavo Growers, Inc. reported fiscal 2018 fourth quarter and full-year operating results. The company, a global avocado-industry leader and expanding provider of value-added fresh food, said that fiscal 2018 revenues and adjusted net income reached new record highs.

item.title: Pepper prices to remain high until new year
item.description: Bell pepper prices have been high for a while, and they aren’t likely to come down until a week or two into 2019.

item.title: Wegmans issues voluntary recall
item.description: Company Press Release: Wegmans Food Markets, Inc. has issued a voluntary recall of fresh Cauliflower Rice, Veggie Cauliflower Rice Blend and Stir-Fry Mix with Cauliflower, sold in the produce department between 12/7/18 and 12/18/18, because it may be contaminated with Escherichia coli O157:H7 bacteria (E. Coli O157:H7). E. coli O157:H7 causes a diarrheal illness often with bloody stools. Although most healthy adults can recover completely within a week, some people can develop a form of kidney failure called Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome (HUS). HUS is most likely to occur in young children and the elderly. The condition can lead to serious kidney damage and even death.

item.title: Broccoli, President Bush and the spirit of giving
item.description: HOUSTON—I’m sure many of us in the fresh produce industry are familiar with President George H.W. Bush’s infamous comments about one of our own prized treasures: broccoli.

item.title: Gift of Produce resumes after Hurricane Harvey hiatus
item.description: HOUSTON—Hurricane Harvey devastated many areas of Houston, and put a strain on resources – including the Gift of Produce from the Houston Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Association.

item.title: Kroger reports third quarter 2018 results
item.description: FINANCIAL RELEASE -- The Kroger Co. reported third quarter 2018 financial results, which ended on November 10, with GAAP net earnings of $317 million, or $0.39 per diluted share. Kroger's third quarter adjusted operating net earnings were $394 million, or $0.48 per diluted share. The 2018 third quarter adjustment item relates to the change in the market value of Kroger's investment in Ocado securities. GAAP net earnings for the third quarter 2017 were $397 million, or $0.44 per diluted share. Kroger reported identical sales growth, without fuel, of 1.6% for the third quarter of 2018.

item.title: Costco maintains solid footing
item.description: Costco’s most recently quarterly report got a mixed review from Wall Street analysts and investors, but the warehouse retailer is in very good shape.

item.title: Spring Policy Summit to feature USMCA/NAFTA negotiator Salvador Behar
item.description: Company Press Release: The Fresh Produce Association of the Americas will be hosting the Spring Policy Summit March 19-20, 2019, at the Tubac Golf Resort and Spa in Tubac, Arizona. The FPAA is excited to present several new speakers this year.

item.title: Kroger announces succession plan for Chief Financial Officer, J. Michael Schlotman
item.description: Company Press Release: The Kroger Co. announced its succession plan for Chief Financial Officer.

item.title: FDA investigating outbreak of E. coli infections likely linked to romaine lettuce
item.description: FDA Recall: The FDA, along with CDC, state and local agencies, is investigating a multistate outbreak of E. coli O157:H7 illnesses linked to romaine lettuce grown in California this fall. The Public Health Agency of Canada (PHAC) and Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) are also coordinating with U.S. agencies as they investigate a similar outbreak in Canada.

item.title: Business changes faster than you think
item.description: If you think financial conditions cannot change in a hurry, think again. General Electric is a great example of a former financial behemoth that is now struggling to survive.

item.title: Spokane Produce voluntarily recalls product
item.description: COMPANY PRESS RELEASE / PRODUCE RECALL - Spokane Produce Inc. of Spokane, WA initiates a voluntary recall of sandwiches containing green leaf lettuce and foodservice lettuce filets following notice of a produce industry ingredient recall by Adam Bros. Farming Inc. Sandwich products bearing the Northwest Cuisine Creations and Fresh & Local labels. These products are recalled because they may be contaminated with Escherichia coli O157:H7 bacteria (E. Coli O157:H7). E. coli O157:H7 causes a diarrheal illness often with bloody stools. Although most healthy adults can recover completely within a week, some people can develop a form of kidney failure called Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome (HUS). HUS is most likely to occur in young children and the elderly. The condition can lead to serious kidney damage and even death.

item.title: Apio, Inc., voluntarily recalls selected Salad Shake Ups™
item.description: COMPANY PRESS RELEASE / PRODUCT RECALL -- Apio, Inc. of Guadalupe, California is voluntarily recalling five SKUs of Eat Smart<sup>®</sup> Single-Serve Salad Shake Ups<sup>™</sup> (bowls). The recall comes after the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) informed the company that one random sample of Eat Smart Single-Serve Salad Shake Ups Sweet Kale/Chou Frise Doux 156 gr. (5.5oz) with Best Before of Dec 14, 2018 tested positive for Listeria Monocytogenes. As a precautionary measure, Apio is recalling all products produced on the same day, same production line, as the one sample that tested positive by CFIA. At this time, they are not aware of any illnesses linked by health officials to this recall and no other products are affected by this recall.

item.title: Reflections on New York Produce Show
item.description: NEW YORK – The New York Produce Show reinforced to attendees how global the fresh produce industry has become.

item.title: Chelan Fruit Cooperative announces new interim CEO
item.description: COMPANY PRESS RELEASE -- Chelan Fruit Cooperative board of directors announced that chief executive officer Reggie Collins will transition from his current position to an advisory position effective Jan. 1, 2019. He will also work with Chelan Fresh Marketing on business and strategic opportunities.

item.title: Ron Carkoski announces retirement
item.description: Company Press Release: Ron Carkoski, who has served as the CEO of four Seasons Family of Companies since 2002, will be retiring on Dec 21st, 2018. Ron started his career at Four Seasons Produce in 1994 as the Director of Procurement after previous leadership roles at Gateway Foods in Wisconsin.

item.title: HKW announces acquisition of Fresh Direct Produce
item.description: Company Press Release: Hammond, Kennedy, Whitney & Company, Inc. ("HKW"), a private equity firm focused on partnering with talented management teams to build world-class companies, announces the acquisition of Fresh Direct Produce, LLC ("Fresh Direct Produce"). Fresh Direct Produce is a distributor of fresh, ethnic, tropical, organic, and specialty produce.

item.title: FDA names farm, narrows scope of romaine outbreak
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration named Adam Bros. Farming of Santa Maria, CA, as testing positive for the E. coli strain involved in the romaine outbreak.

item.title: Report: Whole Foods, Instacart to part ways
item.description: Shortly after Instacart lowered its fees nationwide – making Whole Foods deliveries via Amazon Prime Now costlier – the Wall Street Journal is reporting Whole Foods and Instacart are calling it quits.

item.title: Costco Wholesale Corporation reports first quarter 2019 results
item.description: FINANCIAL RELEASE – Costco Wholesale Corporation announced its operating results for the first quarter (twelve weeks) of fiscal 2019, ended November 25, 2018.

item.title: Produce for Better Health Foundation to Inspire Influencers and Share New Ways to Promote Fruit and Vegetables at The New York Produce Show and Conference
item.description: BRENTWOOD, Mo. (December 13, 2018) – The Produce for Better Health Foundation (PBH) and Produce Business were co-presenters at the Connect with Fresh Media Program — an invite-only lunch workshop for more than 50 influential writers, registered dietitians, lifestyle bloggers, and food and culinary experts, held during the New York Produce Show and Conference at the Javits Center in New York City on Dec. 12.

item.title: Produce industry sees many victories in farm bill
item.description: After months of debate, both the House of Representatives and the Senate passed the farm bill rather quickly this week, and fresh produce was one of the winners.

item.title: Del Monte Foods announces limited recall of canned "fiesta corn" with peppers
item.description: COMPANY PRODUCT RECALL -- Del Monte Foods Inc. announced a recall of 64,242 cases of FIESTA CORN Seasoned with Red & Green Peppers due to under processing. These deviations were part of the commercial sterilization process and could result in contamination by spoilage organisms or pathogens, which could lead to life-threatening illness if consumed. It is important to note that there have been no reports of illness associated with these products to date. No other production codes or products are affected by this recall.

item.title: Dalton Thomas announced as 2019 "Apple Citizen of the Year"
item.description: COMPANY PRESS RELEASE -- Dalton Thomas has been named 2019 Apple Citizen of the Year. Festival Administrator Darci Christoferson and Former Wenatchee Valley College Athletic Director, Sandy Cooprider surprised Dalton with the award at the Oneonta Starr Ranch Growers Christmas Party at the Wenatchee Golf and Country Club, Friday evening. The Apple Citizen of the Year award began in 1981 to honor the roots of the fruit industry and the leaders that make this the Wenatchee Valley the Apple Capital of the World.

item.title: Produce stays above political fray
item.description: Fruits and vegetables aren’t affected in the latest school meals rule and will remain an important part of the program.

item.title: Food Trends 2019: The Has-beens
item.description: In November and December of every year, food industry “observers” and so-called experts come up with a seemingly random list of foods consumers are all going to be excited about over the next 12 months.

item.title: United Fresh encourages quick passage of Farm Bill – this week
item.description: Company Press Release – The United Fresh Produce Association applauds the House and the Senate Farm Bill Conference Committee for approving a Farm Bill conference report, the final report to H.R. 2, the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018. This legislation will direct policy and funding resources for key agriculture programs in the Federal Government for the next five years.

item.title: Food bloggers weigh in on trend realities
item.description: Company Press Release — For the second year in a row FullTilt Marketing, Orlando, FL, surveyed food bloggers from across the country to get their perspective on what they view as the relevant food trends and how those trends are shaping meal time realities for every day consumers.

item.title: USDA cites Tumi Produce International Corp. for PACA Violations
item.description: USDA/AMS PRESS RELEASE – The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has cited Tumi Produce International Corp., Bronx, N.Y., for failure to pay for produce.
